intro: Rupicapnos parvicalcarata, commonly known as the small-spurred rock cress, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other flowering plants with small, four-petaled flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and is adapted to high-altitude environments. Its flowers are usually white or pale yellow, and it produces small, rounded seed pods. Rupicapnos parvicalcarata is often found in alpine meadows and is valued for its ornamental appeal in rock gardens.
